p: In a context of global climate change, seasonality in NC is expected to change in the region [ 13], resulting in longer and warmer but dryer summer seasons. Seasonal variations of climate at the country scale may therefore represent an important determinant of arbovirus outbreaks with adverse effects on viruses and vectors as both temperature and precipitations have been shown to be strongly influence the occurrence of dengue epidemics in NC [ 9, 12].
